examples: the reservation of positions for non-Americans

noun.description: A qualification to an expression of agreement or approval; a doubt.
examples: some generals voiced reservations about making air strikes

noun.description: An area of land set aside for occupation by North American Indians or Australian Aborigines.
A right or interest retained in an estate being conveyed.
(in the Roman Catholic Church) the action of a superior of reserving to himself the power of absolution.

origin: Late Middle English (denoting the Pope's right of nomination to a benefice): from Old French, or from late Latin reservatio(n-), from reservare keep back (see reserve).
